page.title: 08Niton-The Lighthouse(pg.1)
page.content: St.Catherine's Lighthouse,situated at the most southerly point of the I.W., is scheduled as being of special arch- itectural/historical interest.The tower(25m)is octagonal,with a fog signal tower adjoining the south face,also octagonal in shape.Both towers have a castellated parapet and are white in colour.These towers are expressively referred to by local in- habitants as'The Cow and the Calf'.In addition to the main navigation light is a subsidiary light,which is used as a hazard warning and marker for the notorious Atherfield Ledge,WNW of the Lt/Ho.The fog signal consists of two vertical banks of four horns and gives one 3-second blast every 45 seconds. The Lt/Ho.also houses monitoring equipment for the Large Automatic Navigation Buoy(Lanby),at the Owers Station which is 24 miles to the East.
